snippet: A Chinese admiral told a security forum in Singapore that Beijing could create a zone above disputed areas if it felt it was facing a large enough threat.
abstract: Adm Sun Jianguo of China, speaking at security forum in Singapore, says Beijing could create air defense zone above disputed areas of South China if it assessed large enough threat; action, if carried out, would further cement China's military presence in the waters, and be perceived by United States and Southeast Asian countries as major provocation.

byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg contributed reporting from Haiphong, Vietnam. Yufan Huang contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A Chinese admiral told a security forum in Singapore that Beijing could create a zone above disputed areas if it felt it was facing a large enough threat.

headline.main: China Says It Could Set Up Air Defense Zone in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: China Says It Could Add Defense Zone Over Disputed Waters
